SequencePolicy.name: SequencePolicy
SequencePolicy.description: Represents the configuration of rules and parameters for generating unique, sequential numbers for records. Stores settings such as numbering patterns, prefixes, suffixes, sequence start numbers, increment values, and filter criteria to ensure accurate and compliant numbering.

DateStampFormat.description: Required. The format of the stamp date that’s appended to the sequence number.

Description.description: Additional details about the sequencing policy.

EffectiveFromDateTime.description: Required. The date and time when the policy becomes effective.

ExpirationDateTime.description: The date and time when the policy expires.

IncrementByNumber.description: Required. The sequence number increment value.

IsActive.description: Required. Indicates whether the policy is active (true) or not (false).

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed a sequence policy record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed a sequence policy record. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed the sequence policy record or a related list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed the sequence policy record itself.

MaximumSequenceNumber.description: The maximum number the sequence number can reach. The maximum width is determined by the maximum sequence number value.

MinimumSequenceNumberWidth.description: The minimum number of digits a sequence number must have. For example, if the minimum width is set to 3, sequence numbers appear as 001, 002, and so on. If the maximum sequence number is 99999, the width would be 5 digits.

Name.description: Required. The name of the sequence policy.

OwnerId.description: Required. The ID of the user who owns a sequence policy record.

Prefix.description: A string added to the start of the sequence number.

SelectionLogic.description: The logic that determines the records to which the sequence policy applies.

SequenceMode.description: Required. Specifies how sequence numbers are generated.

SequencePattern.description: Required. The structure of a sequence.

Suffix.description: A string added to the end of the sequence number.

TargetObject.description: Required. The object to which the policy is applied.

TimeZone.description: The time zone applicable to the date and time related fields of the policy. When not specified, it takes the user’s time zone by default. The time zone is shown in Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

SequencePolicy.accessRules: the Billing Admin permission set to access this object
